metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9120 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
PHP 7.x through 7.1.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a long string because of an Integer overflow inmysqli_real_escape_string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-cgi - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10').
